page.title: 06The Benfield Valley Plan
page.content: West Hove Golf Course is the only green space linking town and country along the A27 in Southwick & Hove.Its future has been under threat for more than 10 years.The Brighton by-pass is scheduled to take the top part,while a link road will run up most of its length.Wimpeys the house builders own it.The roads have been approved by the Government,but it is uncertain that they will be built because of public spending objections & strong protests by the National Trust.The golf clubs wants to move north of the by-pass,but the Government rejected this idea.Hove Council has produced 2 options.One to use part of the land for much-needed housing.The other is to keep what remains between road functions as a green space. There is a case for housing,provided it's low cost to meet Hove's (CONT-7)
